member.name: T:EvoPdf.Blending
member.summary: The blending function for transparent rendering mode.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode
member.summary: The view mode when an explicit destination is displayed in the viewer.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.XYZ
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.Fit
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitB
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitBH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitBV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore
member.summary: Provides and interface for getting digital certificates from system certificates store or from a password protected PKCS#12 file. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public keys and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the Personal Certificates store. The Personal Certificates store can be accessed from Control Panel/Internet Options, Content, Certificates.
member.returns: The Personal certificates collection.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(EvoPdf.CertSystemStore)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified system certificates store.
member.param: The system certificates store
member.returns: The certificates collection

member.name: M:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified PKCS#12 file. This method uses a NULL password to get the certificates from packet. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public key and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.
member.param: The path of the .pfx or .p12 file storing the certificates.
member.returns: The certificates collection.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified password protected PKCS#12 file. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public key and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.
member.param: The path of the .pfx or .p12 file storing the certificates.

The password used to decrypt and verify the PFX packet. This password must be exactly the same as the password that was used to encrypt the packet. If the password used to encrypt the packet was blank, pass NULL for the value of this parameter.
member.returns: The certificates collection.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.Document.Close
member.summary: Releases all the resources allocated by this PDF document. Always call this method after the document was saved. If the document was created from a stream or file, the stream will be closed if it was not explicitly detached by calling the DetachStream() before the document is closed.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.Document.DetachStream

member.summary: Represents the default PDF document footer template. This footer is automatically considered when calculating the available space for rendering in a PDF page. This template is automatically docked to the bottom of the PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.Document.TransparencyEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the transparency is enabled in the generated PDF document. Default value is true. This property can be set to false to eliminate the additional flattening time when the document is sent to the printer from Adobe Reader viewer.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.Document.Bookmarks
member.summary: Gets the bookmarks collection of the document.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.Document.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the PDF document compression level

member.name: P:EvoPdf.Document.JpegCompressionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the JPEG compression is enabled or not for the images in the generated PDF. By default the JPEG compression is enabled to reduce the size of the generated PDF. When the JPEG compression is enabled the quality of the images in the generated PDF is lower than the quality of the original images in the HTML document, function of the JpegCompressionLevel parameter. When the JpegCompressionLevel is increased, the quality of the images in PDF decreases.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.Document.JpegCompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets the compression level of images in the generated PDF as an integer value between 0 and 100. This property has effect only when the JpegCompressionEnabled is true. When the JpegCompressionLevel is 0, the compression rate is the lowest and the quality of the images is the best. When the JpegCompressionLevel is 100, the compression rate is the highest and quality of the images in PDF is the worst. The default JPEG compression level is 10, which should offer a good balance between the compression rate and the quality of the images in PDF.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.DocumentViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the document’s window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the document’s contents displayed. Default value: False.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.DocumentViewerPreferences.FitWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to resize the document’s window to fit the size of the first displayed page. Default value: False.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.DocumentViewerPreferences.CenterWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to position the document’s window in the center of the screen. Default value: False.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.DocumentViewerPreferences.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the window’s title bar should display the document title taken from the title entry of the document information dictionary. Default value: False.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.DocumentViewerPreferences.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: The document’s page mode, specifying how to display the document on exiting full-screen mode. This entry is meaningful only if the value of the PageMode entry in the catalog dictionary is FullScreen; it is ignored otherwise. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.DocumentViewerPreferences.Direction
member.summary: The predominant reading order for text. Default value: L2R.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.DocumentViewerPreferences.PageMode
member.summary: Specifies how the document should be displayed when opened. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.DocumentViewerPreferences.PageLayout
member.summary: The page layout to be used when the document is opened. Default value: OneColumn.

member.summary: The zero based index of the PDF page containing this rectangle.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlElementPdfRectangle.Rectangle
member.summary: The rectangle position inside the PDF page drawing area. The drawing area of the PDF page does not include the page margins, header or footer. The rectangle dimensions are expressed in points (1 point is 1/72 inch).

member.name: T:EvoPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Defines the necessary API to retrieve the positions in the generated PDF document for the HTML elements specified in a list. The HTML elements are specified by their unique HTML ID or HTML tag name.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions.HtmlElementSelectors
member.summary: This property is used to set an array containing the selectors of the HTML elements for which to retrieve position in PDF. For example, the selector for all the image elements is "img", the selector for all the elements with the CSS class name 'myclass' is "*.myclass" and the selector for the elements with the id 'myid' is "*#myid". The elements mapping will be retrieved in the HtmlElementsMappingResult property after conversion.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions.HtmlElementsMappingResult
member.summary: This property is set by the converter after conversion and returns the mapping of the HTML elements specified by the HtmlElementIds and HtmlTagNames lists.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.PrepareRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised after the converter created the PDF page and before starting rendering it. In the handler of this event the PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer can still be changed before starting rendering.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.BeforeRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right before the page is rendered by converter. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the background of the PDF page to be rendered.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.AfterRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right after the converter finished PDF page rendering. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the foreground of the rendered PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred HTML viewer width in pixels. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width can also be specified in the PdfConverter class constructor. The default value is 1024 pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property of the PdfConverter class. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer height can also be specified in the PdfConverter class contructor. The default value is 0 to automatically determine the HTML viewer height based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ClipHtmlView
member.summary: If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the resulted image will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When false the image will be rendered at the real size. By default this property is true and the image will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the resulted image will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect only when FitWidth property is true. When FitWidth is true and this property is true the HTML content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.LiveUrlsEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the HTML links in PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the internal HTML links to internal PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if JavaScript execution is enabled in converter. The default is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.Paginate
member.summary: When true the element can be paginated

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HttpPostFields
member.summary: Returns the collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page. If there are elements in collection then the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection, otherwise it will make a GET request

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type of the HTML document. The default media type is 'screen'. If you set this property with 'print' then the CSS properties defined in '@media print' rule will be used to render the document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.SvgFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the SVG fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.WebFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the Web Fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ExtensionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML viewer extensions are executed. The default value is false and no extension is executed. The Flash player for Mozilla Firefox must be installed in order to execute the flash content from HTML

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.InterruptSlowJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the slow JavaScript script should be interrupted. The default value is false and the scripts are not interrupted

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.RenderedHtmlElementSelector
member.summary: Get or set the CSS selector of the HTML element to be rendered. If the selector selects multiple HTML elements, only the the first one will be converted. The CSS selector is case sensitive. If this property is not set then the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.MaxHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels to be rendered from the HTML document. The default value is 0 and the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.MinHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height in pixels to be rendered from HTML document. This value of this property is ignored if the MaxHtmlViewerHeight property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ImagePartSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels of an image part

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.TriggeringMode
member.summary: The conversion triggering mode. The default value is Auto

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be completely loaded or for a web page redirect to finish before starting the rendering.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP headers to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. A custom HTTP header is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestHeaders property. The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. By default the PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property is false and the custom headers are not automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested. The custom HTTP headers can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser. The preferred method to send cookies is to use the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.PersistentHttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers defined by the HttpRequestHeaders property each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. The default value of this property is true and the custom headers are automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HttpRequestCookies
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP cookies to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page to convert and the resources (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page are requested. A cookie is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.XPSupplementalLanguages
member.summary: A flag indicating if the supplemental languages (complex script, right-to-left, East Asian) support was enabled in Windows XP Regional and Language Options. The default value is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.EvoInternalFileName
member.summary: Sets the full path of evointernal.dat helper file. By default this file is expected to be found in the same folder with evohtmltopdf.dll assembly.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object encapsulating the proxy options used to access the HTML document to convert.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ImpersonationOptions
member.summary: The impersonation options applied during navigation

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.PdfBookmarkOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the bookmarks creation for the rendered PDF document. In order to enable creation of bookmarks you have to set the TagNames property of PdfBookmarkOptions with the names of the HTML tags you want to bookmark.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the retrieval of HTML elements position in the generated PDF. In order to retrieve the position in PDF for a list of HTML elements, the HtmlElementIds property of HtmlElementsMappingOptions must be set with an array of strings containing the HTML IDs of the HTML elements. The positions of the HTML elements in the generated PDF document will be returned in the HtmlElementsMappingResult object after the element was added to the page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.RenderedPagesRectangles
member.summary: The bounds of the rendered rectangle on each PDF page. This property is assigned after the element has been added to a PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets an object populated after conversion with the title, keywords, and description of the converted HTML document.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement
member.summary: This class encapsulates a HTML to PDF converter. The HTML to PDF conversion is performed when the element is added to a PDF page.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AUTO_PDF_HEIGHT_POINTS

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element that will be rendered at the (0,0) location in PDF page. The width of element in PDF page is the available width in PDF page and the height is auto determined.
member.param: The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element at the specified x and y coordinates with the specified width and height. The virtual browser width and height in pixels is specified by the htmlViewerWidth and htmlViewerHeight parameters.
member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

The destination height in points for the rendered content. If the specified height is less or equal 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered. Please note that the specified height is the effective height that will be rendered in the PDF document and does not include for example the empty spaces introduced by custom or automatic page breaks.
The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used.
The virtual browser width in pixels. The default value is 1024 pixels. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width.

The virtual browser height in pixels. The default value is 0 which means the height will be auto-determined. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width and height. When this parameter is less or equal to 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page height from the HTML document content.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PrepareRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised after the converter created the PDF page and before starting rendering it. In the handler of this event the PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer can still be changed before starting rendering.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.BeforeRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right before the page is rendered by converter. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the background of the PDF page to be rendered.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AfterRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right after the converter finished PDF page rendering. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the foreground of the rendered PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred HTML viewer width in pixels. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width can also be specified in the PdfConverter class constructor. The default value is 1024 pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property of the PdfConverter class. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer height can also be specified in the PdfConverter class contructor. The default value is 0 to automatically determine the HTML viewer height based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ClipHtmlView
member.summary: If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AvoidTextBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the text between PDF pages

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AvoidImageBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the images between PDF pages

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When false the HTML content will be rendered at the real size. By default this property is true and the content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect only when FitWidth property is true. When FitWidth is true and this property is true the HTML content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.LiveUrlsEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the HTML links in PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the internal HTML links to internal PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if JavaScript execution is enabled in converter. The default is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.Paginate
member.summary: When true the element can be paginated

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.EmbedFonts
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to embed all the true type fonts into the PDF document. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HttpPostFields
member.summary: Returns the collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page. If there are elements in collection then the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection, otherwise it will make a GET request

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type of the HTML document. The default media type is 'screen'. If you set this property with 'print' then the CSS properties defined in '@media print' rule will be used to render the document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.SvgFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the SVG fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.WebFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the Web Fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ExtensionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML viewer extensions are executed. The default value is false and no extension is executed. The Flash player for Mozilla Firefox must be installed in order to execute the flash content from HTML

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.InterruptSlowJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the slow JavaScript script should be interrupted. The default value is false and the scripts are not interrupted

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HiddenHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements to be excluded from rendering

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.RenderedHtmlElementSelector
member.summary: Get or set the CSS selector of the HTML element to be rendered. If the selector selects multiple HTML elements, only the the first one will be converted. The CSS selector is case sensitive. If this property is not set then the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.MaxHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels to be rendered from the HTML document. The default value is 0 and the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.MinHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height in pixels to be rendered from HTML document. This value of this property is ignored if the MaxHtmlViewerHeight property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ImagePartSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels of an image part

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.TriggeringMode
member.summary: The conversion triggering mode. The default value is Auto

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be completely loaded or for a web page redirect to finish before starting the rendering.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP headers to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. A custom HTTP header is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestHeaders property. The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. By default the PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property is false and the custom headers are not automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested. The custom HTTP headers can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser. The preferred method to send cookies is to use the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PersistentHttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers defined by the HttpRequestHeaders property each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. The default value of this property is true and the custom headers are automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HttpRequestCookies
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP cookies to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page to convert and the resources (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page are requested. A cookie is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.XPSupplementalLanguages
member.summary: A flag indicating if the supplemental languages (complex script, right-to-left, East Asian) support was enabled in Windows XP Regional and Language Options. The default value is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.TiledRenderingEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if rendering of HTML document is tiled. This property is true by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.DoublePrecisionCoordinates
member.summary: A flag indicating if the coordinates in PDF are in double precision. The default property value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.EvoInternalFileName
member.summary: Sets the full path of evointernal.dat helper file. By default this file is expected to be found in the same folder with evohtmltopdf.dll assembly.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object encapsulating the proxy options used to access the HTML document to convert.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ImpersonationOptions
member.summary: The impersonation options applied during navigation

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PdfBookmarkOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the bookmarks creation for the rendered PDF document. In order to enable creation of bookmarks the HtmlElementSelectors property of PdfBookmarkOptions object can be set with an array of selectors of the HTML elements to be bookmarked.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that can be used to obtain the position of the HTML elements in the generated PDF. In order to get the position in PDF for a selected set of HTML elements, the HtmlElementSelectors property of HtmlElementsMappingOptions object can be set with an array of selectors of the HTML elements for which to return position in PDF. The positions of the HTML elements in the generated PDF document will be returned in the HtmlElementsMappingResult object.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.RenderedPagesRectangles

member.name: E:EvoPdf.ImageElement.AfterRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right after the converter finished PDF page rendering. member.name: T:EvoPdf.ImgConverter
member.summary: This class offers the necessary API to create images in various formats from a specified web page

member.name: M:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an image converter using the default width and height for the HTML viewer. The default HTML viewer width is 1024 pixels and the default HTML viewer height is 0 which means the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the default width of 1024 pixels, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the HtmlViewerWidth and HtmlViewerHeight properties of the ImgConverter class.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an image converter using the specified width in pixels and the default height for the HTML viewer. The default HTML viewer height is 0 which means the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the HtmlViewerWidth and HtmlViewerHeight properties of the ImgConverter class.
member.param: The preferred HTML viewer width in pixels.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an image converter using the specified width and height in pixels for the HTML viewer. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the HtmlViewerWidth and HtmlViewerHeight properties of the ImgConverter class.
member.param: The preferred HTML viewer width in pixels.
The preferred HTML viewer height in pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred HTML viewer width in pixels. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width can also be specified in the ImgConverter class constructor. The default value is 1024 pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer height can also be specified in the ImgConverter class contructor. The default value is 0 to automatically determine the HTML viewer height based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.ClipHtmlView
member.summary: If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key string received from the vendor. If this property is null the converter will automatically enter in evaluation mode and a demo watermark will be displayed on the generated image.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if JavaScript execution is enabled in converter. The default is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.ImpersonationOptions
member.summary: The impersonation options applied during navigation

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.PdfBookmarkOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the bookmarks creation for the rendered PDF document. In order to enable creation of bookmarks you have to set the TagNames property of PdfBookmarkOptions with the names of the HTML tags you want to bookmark.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the retrieval of HTML elements position in the generated PDF. In order to retrieve the position in PDF for a list of HTML elements, the HtmlElementIds and HtmlTagNames properties of HtmlElementsMappingOptions must be set with an array of strings containing the HTML IDs and tag names of the HTML elements. The positions of the HTML elements in the generated PDF document will be returned in the HtmlElementsMappingResult object.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object encapsulating the proxy options used to access the HTML document to convert.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.TransparentBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the resulted image will have a transparent background when converting a HTML documement without a defined background color or image. This property is false by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.HttpPostFields
member.summary: Returns the collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page. If there are elements in collection then the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection, otherwise it will make a GET request

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type of the HTML document. The default media type is 'screen'. If you set this property with 'print' then the CSS properties defined in '@media print' rule will be used to render the document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.SvgFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the SVG fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.WebFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the Web Fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.ExtensionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML viewer extensions are executed. The default value is false and no extension is executed. The Flash player for Mozilla Firefox must be installed in order to execute the flash content from HTML

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.InterruptSlowJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the slow JavaScript script should be interrupted. The default value is false and the scripts are not interrupted

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.HiddenHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements to be excluded from rendering

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.RenderedHtmlElementSelector
member.summary: Get or set the CSS selector of the HTML element to be rendered. If the selector selects multiple HTML elements, only the the first one will be converted. The CSS selector is case sensitive. If this property is not set then the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.MaxHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels to be rendered from the HTML document. The default value is 0 and the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.MinHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height in pixels to be rendered from HTML document. This value of this property is ignored if the MaxHtmlViewerHeight property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.ImagePartSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels of an image part

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.TriggeringMode
member.summary: The conversion triggering mode. The default value is Auto

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be completely loaded or for a web page redirect to finish before starting the rendering.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP headers to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. A custom HTTP header is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestHeaders property. The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. By default the PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property is false and the custom headers are not automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested. The custom HTTP headers can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser. The preferred method to send cookies is to use the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.PersistentHttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers defined by the HttpRequestHeaders property each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. The default value of this property is true and the custom headers are automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.HttpRequestCookies
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP cookies to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page to convert and the resources (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page are requested. A cookie is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImgConverter.XPSupplementalLanguages
member.summary: A flag indicating if the supplemental languages (complex script, right-to-left, East Asian) support was enabled in Windows XP Regional and Language Options. The default value is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImpersonationOptions.Password

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImpersonationOptions.LogonMode
member.summary: The logon mode of the user before navigation. This property has effect only when a username for impersonation is specified. The default logon mode is automatic.

member.summary: The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments are extended until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle (as defined by the miter limit parameter— see "Miter Limit"), a bevel join is used instead.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.LineJoinStyle.RoundJoin
member.summary: An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pie slice-shaped figure is filled in, producing a rounded corner.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.LineJoinStyle.BevelJoin
member.summary: The two segments are finished with caps (see "Line Cap Style") and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments is filled with a triangle.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.PdfConverter
member.summary: This class is the main class of the HTML to PDF Converter which offers the necessary methods to create a PDF document from a web page or from a HTML string. The generated PDF document can be saved in memory or in a file.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a HTML to PDF converter using the default width and height for the HTML viewer. The default HTML viewer width is 1024 pixels and the default HTML viewer height is 0 which means the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the default width of 1024 pixels, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped to the width set for the HTML viewer or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the HtmlViewerWidth and HtmlViewerHeight properties of the PdfConverter class.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML to PDF converter using the specified width in pixels and the default height for the HTML viewer. The default HTML viewer height is 0 which means the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the HtmlViewerWidth and HtmlViewerHeight properties of the PdfConverter class.
member.param: The HTML document width in pixels

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML to PDF using the specified width and height in pixels for the HTML viewer. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the HtmlViewerWidth and HtmlViewerHeight properties of the PdfConverter class
member.param: The HTML document width in pixels
The HTML document height in pixels

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified URL to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
member.param: The URL of the web page to be converted to PDF. The URL can be also the full path of a HTML file from the local file system.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlFile(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML file to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
member.param: The full path of the HTML file to be converted to PDF.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlString(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML string to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion. This method does not use any URL base and therefore the images or CSS files referenced by relative URLs in the HTML string cannot be resolved by the converter to a full URL. Also, because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the internal links, the internal links might not be correctly converted. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML string to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion. The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. Because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the internal links, the urlBase will be used by default. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.

The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. When a relative URL from the HTML string is prefixed by the urlBase, the correct full URL of the image or of the CSS file should be produced. When the urlBase is not null, the converter automatically inserts a <BASE HREF="urlBase"> tag under the HEAD tag from the HTML string. If the HTML string does not contain a HEAD tag, the urlBase parameter does not have any effect.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlString(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML string to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.
The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string.
The full URL of the document referenced by the internal links from the HTML string.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlStream(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the HTML string read from the specified HTML stream to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion. This method does not use any URL base and therefore the images or CSS files referenced by relative URLs in the HTML string cannot be resolved by the converter to a full URL. Also, because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the links with anchors, all the links with anchors are considered to be internal links. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlStream method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML stream containing the HTML string to be converted to PDF.
The encoding of the string read from the HTML stream.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the PDF document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified HTML string to PDF and returns the rendered PDF document as an array of bytes. The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. Because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the internal links, the urlBase will be used by default. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.

The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. When a relative URL from the HTML string is prefixed by the urlBase, the correct full URL of the image or of the CSS file should be produced. When the urlBase is not null, the converter automatically inserts a <BASE HREF="urlBase"> tag under the HEAD tag from the HTML string. If the HTML string does not contain a HEAD tag, the urlBase parameter does not have any effect.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the PDF document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString(System.String,System.String,System.String)

The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string.
The full URL of the document referenced by the internal links from the HTML string.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the PDF document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfBytesFromHtmlStream(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Converts the HTML string read from the specified HTML stream to PDF and returns the rendered PDF document as an array of bytes. This method does not use any URL base and therefore the images or CSS files referenced by relative URLs in the HTML string cannot be resolved by the converter to a full URL. Also, because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the links with anchors, all the links with anchors are considered to be internal links. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlStream method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML stream containing the HTML string to be converted to PDF.
The encoding of the string read from the HTML stream.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the PDF document.
