member.name: E:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PrepareRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised after the converter created the PDF page and before starting rendering it. In the handler of this event the PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer can still be changed before starting rendering.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.BeforeRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right before the page is rendered by converter. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the background of the PDF page to be rendered.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.AfterRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right after the converter finished PDF page rendering. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the foreground of the rendered PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred HTML viewer width in pixels. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width can also be specified in the PdfConverter class constructor. The default value is 1024 pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property of the PdfConverter class. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer height can also be specified in the PdfConverter class contructor. The default value is 0 to automatically determine the HTML viewer height based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.ClipHtmlView
member.summary: If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key string received from the vendor. If this property is null the converter will automatically enter in evaluation mode and a demo watermark will be displayed on the generated PDF document.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PdfDocumentOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the conversion process and the generated PDF document properties. This property can be used to control the PDF document margins, PDF compression level, JPEG compression level, the PDF page size and orientation, the PDF document headers and footers, conversion of the URLs to links in PDF, conversion of the HTML links with anchors to internal PDF links, true type fonts embedding, fit width and stretch to fit, conversion to a single PDF page, append or prepend external PDF documents.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.ImpersonationOptions
member.summary: The impersonation options applied during navigation

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PdfDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object to controlling the generated PDF document information like the document title, author, subject or creation date.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PdfSecurityOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object to controlling the generated PDF document security settings like user and owner password, restrict printing or editing of the generated PDF document.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PdfHeaderOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object to control the generated PDF document header options. The header is displayed in the generated PDF document if the PdfDocumentOptions.ShowHeader property is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PdfFooterOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object to control the generated PDF document footer options. The footer is displayed in the generated PDF document if the PdfDocumentOptions.ShowFooter property is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PdfBookmarkOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the bookmarks creation for the rendered PDF document. In order to enable creation of bookmarks the HtmlElementSelectors property of PdfBookmarkOptions object can be set with an array of selectors of the HTML elements to be bookmarked.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that can be used to obtain the position of the HTML elements in the generated PDF. In order to get the position in PDF for a selected set of HTML elements, the HtmlElementSelectors property of HtmlElementsMappingOptions object can be set with an array of selectors of the HTML elements for which to return position in PDF. The positions of the HTML elements in the generated PDF document will be returned in the HtmlElementsMappingResult object.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object encapsulating the proxy options used to access the HTML document to convert.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PdfViewerPreferences
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling how the generated PDF is displayed by the PDF viewer.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.ConversionSummary
member.summary: Offers summary information about the conversion process. After a successfull conversion this property is initialized with an instance of the ConversionSummary class. If the conversion failed this property returns a null value.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.HtmlDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets an object populated after conversion with the title, keywords, and description of the converted HTML document. This information can be used for example in the to set the corresponding fields of the PdfDocumentInfo property of a Document object obtained after conversion.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if JavaScript execution is enabled in converter. The default is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.HttpPostFields
member.summary: Returns the collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page. If there are elements in collection then the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection, otherwise it will make a GET request

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type of the HTML document. The default media type is 'screen'. If you set this property with 'print' then the CSS properties defined in '@media print' rule will be used to render the document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.SvgFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the SVG fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.WebFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the Web Fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.ExtensionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML viewer extensions are executed. The default value is false and no extension is executed. The Flash player for Mozilla Firefox must be installed in order to execute the flash content from HTML

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.InterruptSlowJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the slow JavaScript script should be interrupted. The default value is false and the scripts are not interrupted

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.HiddenHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements to be excluded from rendering

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.RenderedHtmlElementSelector
member.summary: Get or set the CSS selector of the HTML element to be rendered. If the selector selects multiple HTML elements, only the the first one will be converted. The CSS selector is case sensitive. If this property is not set then the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.MaxHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels to be rendered from the HTML document. The default value is 0 and the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.MinHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height in pixels to be rendered from HTML document. This value of this property is ignored if the MaxHtmlViewerHeight property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.ImagePartSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels of an image part

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.TriggeringMode
member.summary: The conversion triggering mode. The default value is Auto

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be completely loaded or for a web page redirect to finish before starting the rendering.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP headers to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. A custom HTTP header is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestHeaders property. The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. By default the PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property is false and the custom headers are not automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested. The custom HTTP headers can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser. The preferred method to send cookies is to use the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PersistentHttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers defined by the HttpRequestHeaders property each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. The default value of this property is true and the custom headers are automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.HttpRequestCookies
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP cookies to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page to convert and the resources (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page are requested. A cookie is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.XPSupplementalLanguages
member.summary: A flag indicating if the supplemental languages (complex script, right-to-left, East Asian) support was enabled in Windows XP Regional and Language Options. The default value is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.EvoInternalFileName
member.summary: Sets the full path of evointernal.dat helper file. By default this file is expected to be found in the same folder with evohtmltopdf.dll assembly.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfConverter.PdfConverterConcurrencyLevel
member.summary: This static parameter gives the maximum number of threads in the current .NET application domain that can convert HTML to PDF simultaneously. This parameter must be set before the first conversion performed in the current application domain. When this property is set with a negative value or zero the concurrency level is maximum. The default value is 4.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentException
member.summary: Exception thrown by the Pdf Creator library

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The exception message

member.name: M:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The exception message
The inner exception that triggered this exception

member.name: T:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentInfo
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the PDF document description (author, title, keywords, etc). The PDFConverter class define a reference to an object of this type

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentInfo.AuthorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the PDF document author.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentInfo.CreatedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time when the PDF document was created.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentInfo.Keywords
member.summary: Gets or sets the PDF document keywords.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentInfo.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the subject of the PDF document.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentInfo.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets PDF document title.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the PDF document redering process. The PdfConverter class define a reference to an object of this type.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.LeftMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document left margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.RightMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document right margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.TopMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document top margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.BottomMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document bottom margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfCompressionLevel
member.summary: This property controls the compression level of the rendered PDF document.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.JpegCompressionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the JPEG compression is enabled or not for the images in the generated PDF. By default the JPEG compression is enabled to reduce the size of the generated PDF. When the JPEG compression is enabled the quality of the images in the generated PDF is lower than the quality of the original images in the HTML document, function of the JpegCompressionLevel parameter. When the JpegCompressionLevel is increased, the quality of the images in PDF decreases.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.JpegCompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level of images in the generated PDF as an integer value between 0 and 100. This property has effect only when the JpegCompressionEnabled is true. When the JpegCompressionLevel is 0, the compression rate is the lowest and the quality of the images is the best. When the JpegCompressionLevel is 100, the compression rate is the highest and quality of the images in PDF is the worst. The default JPEG compression level is 10, which should offer a good balance between the compression rate and the quality of the images in PDF.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.CompressCrossReference
member.summary: Set this property on true to store the PDF cross-reference table and PDF trailer in compressed cross-reference streams and to reduce the PDF file size. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfPageSize
member.summary: This property controls the size of the rendered PDF document pages. The default size of the PDF document is A4

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfStandardSubset
member.summary: Defines the PDF subset used by the generated PDF. The default value is Full. This property can be used to instruct the converter to generate PDF/A, PDF/X or PDF/SiqQ compliant documents.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the color space of the generated PDF document. The possible values are RGB, CMYK or Gray Scale. The default color space is RGB.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is true and the content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When this property is false the HTML content is not resized (is rendered at the real size) and therefore it could be cut off at the right size if the PDF page is not enough wide to display the whole HTML content. In this case the AutoSizePdfPage property can be set on true to automatically resize the PDF page width to display the whole content.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect only when FitWidth property is true. When FitWidth is true and this property is true the HTML content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.SinglePage
member.summary: When this property is true the converter will generate a single PDF page with a custom size calculated to display the whole HTML content and any specified header and footer. If the FitWidth property is true the specified PDF page width will be preserved, otherwise the PDF page width is automatically calculated by the converter to display the whole HTML content at real size.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AutoSizePdfPage
member.summary: When the property AutoSizePdfPage property is true the converter will automatically calculate the PDF page size such that all the HTML content will be visible in the resulted PDF document. This property has effect only when the FitWidth and FitHeight properties are false. When the FitWidth property is false (the HTML content is rendered at real size) and the AutoSizePdfPage is false the rendered HTML content could be cut off at the right of the generated PDF document if the PDF page is not wide enough to display the whole content. This property is true by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AvoidTextBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the text between PDF pages. By default this property is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AvoidImageBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the images between PDF pages. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfPageOrientation
member.summary: This property controls the page orientation of the rendered PDF document pages. The default orientation is Portrait.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.GenerateSelectablePdf
member.summary: When this property is true the generated PDF will contain selectable text. When this property is false, the converter will embed a snapshot image of the HTML document in PDF. The default value of this property is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.ShowHeader
member.summary: This property controls the whether the header appears or not in the rendered PDF document. The header properties can be further customized by setting the properties of the PDFHeaderOptions object exposed by the PDFHeaderOptions property of the PdfConverter class. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.EmbedFonts
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to embed all the true type fonts into the PDF document. The default value of this property is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.LiveUrlsEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the external links from HTML to PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the internal HTML links (links with anchors) to internal PDF links. This feature can be used for example to create table of contents in the generated PDF. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.ShowFooter
member.summary: This property controls the whether the footer appears or not in the rendered PDF document. The footer properties can be further customized by setting the properties of the PDFFooterOptions object exposed by the PDFFooterOptions property of the PDFConverter class. The default value is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.TiledRenderingEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if rendering of HTML document is tiled. This property is true by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.DoublePrecisionCoordinates
member.summary: A flag indicating if the coordinates in PDF are in double precision. The default property value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.TransparencyEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the transparency is enabled in the generated PDF document. Default value is true. This property can be set to false to eliminate the additional flattening time when the document is sent to the printer from Adobe Reader viewer.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags
member.summary: The submit form action flags to be combined to express various characteristics of the action

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.Default
member.summary: The default value of the flags

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeExclude
member.summary: If clear, the Fields array specifies which fields to include in the submission. If set, the Fields array tells which fields to exclude

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeNoValueFields
member.summary: If set, all fields designated by the Fields array and the Include/Exclude flag shall be submitted, regardless of whether they have a value. For fields without a value, only the field name shall betransmitted. If clear, fields without a value shall not be submitted

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.ExportFormat
member.summary: Meaningful only if the SubmitPDF and XFDF flags are clear. If set, field names and values shall be submitted in HTML Form format. If clear, they shall be submitted in Forms Data Format

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.GetMethod
member.summary: If set, field names and values shall be submitted using an HTTP GET request. If clear, they shall be submitted using a POST request. This flag is meaningful only when the ExportFormat flag is set; if ExportFormat is clear, this flag shall also be clear

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.SubmitCoordinates
member.summary: If set, the coordinates of the mouse click that caused the submit-form action shall be transmitted as part of the form data. The coordinate values are relative to the upper-left corner of the field’s widget annotation rectangle. This flag shall be used only when the ExportFormat flag is set. If ExportFormat is clear, this flag shall also be clear

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.XFDF
member.summary: Shall be used only if the SubmitPDF flags are clear. If set, field names and values shall be submitted as XFDF

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeAppendSaves
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF file shall include the contents of all incremental updates to the underlying PDF document, as contained in the Differences entry in the FDF dictionary. If clear, the incremental updates shall not be included

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeAnnotations
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF file shall include includes all markup annotations in the underlying PDF document. If clear, markup annotations shall not be included

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.SubmitPDF
member.summary: If set, the document shall be submitted as PDF, using the MIME content type application/pdf. If set, all other flags shall be ignored except GetMethod

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.CanonicalFormat
member.summary: If set, any submitted field values representing dates shall be converted to the standard format

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.ExclNonUserAnnots
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear) and the IncludeAnnotations flag is set. If set, it shall include only those markup annotations whose T entry matches the name of the current user, as determined by the remote server to which the form is being submitted.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.ExclFKey
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF shall exclude the F entry.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.EmbedForm
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the F entry of the submitted FDF shall be a file specification containing an embedded file stream representing the PDF file from which the FDF is being submitted

member.summary: Can copy the document content.

member.summary: Can fill the form fields. This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used. To disable form filling the CanEditContent and CanEditAnnotations must be set on false.

member.summary: Can print the document.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.KeySize
member.summary: The dimension of the encryption key. By default a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.OwnerPassword
member.summary: The password required to change permissions of the PDF document like printing or editing. If the OwnerPassword property is an empty string and the UserPassword is not empty, the OwnerPassword will be automatically assigned with the value from UserPassword and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.UserPassword
member.summary: The password required to open the PDF document. If the OwnerPassword property is an empty string and the UserPassword is not empty, the OwnerPassword will be automatically assigned with the value from UserPassword and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.PdfStandardSubset.Pdf_A_1b
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/A 1b standard which makes the document suitable for long term archiving. All the true type fonts are embedded in the PDF document, external HTTP links are disabled, transparencies are disabled, and some special metadata to identify the document as PDF/A compliant is inserted in the generated document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.#ctor

member.name: M:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.GetSvgFromUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified URL into a SVG document and returns the rendered SVG document as an array of bytes. This method can be used to perform HTML to SVG conversion in internal memory.
member.param: The URL of the web page to be converted to PDF. The URL can be also the full path of a HTML file from the local file system.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the SVG document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.GetSvgFromHtmlString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified HTML string into a SVG document and returns the rendered SVG document as an array of bytes. This method can be used to perform HTML to SVG conversion in internal memory.
member.param: The HTML string to convert.

This parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. If there are not relative URLs in the HTML code this parameter can be empty or null.
member.returns: The SVG document as a memory buffer.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.ConvertUrlToStream(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Converts the specified URL into a SVG document and saves the rendered SVG document to the specified stream.
member.param: The URL of the web page to be converted to PDF. The URL can be also the full path of a HTML file from the local file system.
The output stream where to save the generated SVG document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.ConvertHtmlToStream(System.String,System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Converts the specified HTML string into a SVG document and saves the rendered SVG document to the specified stream.
member.param: The HTML string to convert.

This parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. If there are not relative URLs in the HTML code this parameter can be empty or null.
The output stream where to save the generated SVG document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.ConvertUrlToFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified URL into a SVG document and saves the rendered SVG document to the specified file.
member.param: The URL of the web page to be converted to PDF. The URL can be also the full path of a HTML file from the local file system.
The output file where to save the generated SVG document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.ConvertHtmlToFile(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified HTML string into a SVG document and saves the rendered SVG document to the specified file.
member.param: The HTML string to convert.

This parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. If there are not relative URLs in the HTML code this parameter can be empty or null.
The output file where to save the generated SVG document.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.OutputResolution
member.summary: The resolution of the SVG document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.OutputSize
member.summary: A flag indicating if the calculated size of the SVG document should be set in the generated document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred HTML viewer width in pixels. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the ClipHtmlView property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width can also be specified in the ImgConverter class constructor. The default value is 1024 pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer height can also be specified in the ImgConverter class contructor. The default value is 0 to automatically determine the HTML viewer height based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.ClipHtmlView
member.summary: If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key string received from the vendor. If this property is null the converter will automatically enter in evaluation mode and a demo watermark will be displayed on the generated image.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if JavaScript execution is enabled in converter. The default is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.ImpersonationOptions
member.summary: The impersonation options applied during navigation

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object encapsulating the proxy options used to access the HTML document to convert.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.HttpPostFields
member.summary: Returns the collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page. If there are elements in collection then the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection, otherwise it will make a GET request

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type of the HTML document. The default media type is 'screen'. If you set this property with 'print' then the CSS properties defined in '@media print' rule will be used to render the document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.SvgFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the SVG fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.WebFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the Web Fonts are enabled in HTML. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.ExtensionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML viewer extensions are executed. The default value is false and no extension is executed. The Flash player for Mozilla Firefox must be installed in order to execute the flash content from HTML

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.InterruptSlowJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the slow JavaScript script should be interrupted. The default value is false and the scripts are not interrupted

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.RenderedHtmlElementSelector
member.summary: Get or set the CSS selector of the HTML element to be rendered. If the selector selects multiple HTML elements, only the the first one will be converted. The CSS selector is case sensitive. If this property is not set then the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.MaxHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels to be rendered from the HTML document. The default value is 0 and the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.MinHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height in pixels to be rendered from HTML document. This value of this property is ignored if the MaxHtmlViewerHeight property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.TriggeringMode
member.summary: The conversion triggering mode. The default value is Auto

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be completely loaded or for a web page redirect to finish before starting the rendering.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP headers to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. A custom HTTP header is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestHeaders property. The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. By default the PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property is false and the custom headers are not automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested. The custom HTTP headers can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser. The preferred method to send cookies is to use the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.PersistentHttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers defined by the HttpRequestHeaders property each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. The default value of this property is true and the custom headers are automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.HttpRequestCookies
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP cookies to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page to convert and the resources (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page are requested. A cookie is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the Add(string, string) method of the HttpRequestCookies property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.SvgConverter.EvoInternalFileName
member.summary: Sets the full path of evointernal.dat helper file. By default this file is expected to be found in the same folder with evohtmltopdf.dll assembly.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.TemplateAnchoring.BottomRight

member.name: T:EvoPdf.TextElement
member.summary: Represents a text element to be added to a PDF page or template.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.String,EvoPdf.PdfFont)
member.summary:
Contructs a paginable text element that will be rendered at the specified (x,y) position using the specified font. The height of the rendered text will be auto-determined. The width is the available width in page.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the embedFont parameter of Document.Fonts.Add(System.Drawing.Font font, bool embedFont) is true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( Paginate property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being limited by the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( Paginate property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the auto-determined text height is bigger than the available space on page), all the text will be rendered using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.

member.summary:
Contructs a paginable text element that will be rendered at the specified (x,y) position using the specified width and font. The height of the rendered text will be auto-determined.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the embedFont parameter of Document.Fonts.Add(System.Drawing.Font font, bool embedFont) is true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( Paginate property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being limited by the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( Paginate property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the auto-determined text height is bigger than the available space on page), all the text will be rendered using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The width of the destination rectangle
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,EvoPdf.PdfFont)
member.summary:
Contructs a paginable text element that will be rendered in the specified rectangle using the specified width, height and font.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the embedFont parameter of Document.Fonts.Add(System.Drawing.Font font, bool embedFont) is true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( Paginate property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being given by the minimum between the specified height and the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( Paginate property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the specified height is bigger than the available space on page), the height parameter will be ignored and the text will be rendered to the end using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed but the text does not need pagination (the specified height is less than the available space on page), the rendered text will be truncated to fit the specified height. The text bounds inside the current page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The width of the destination rectangle
The height of the destination rectangle
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.
